events.title: Birth
events.event: Born into the Julius family, a patrician family in Rome
events.personality: Curious, resilient child with a sense of duty and ambition.

events.title: Political Career Begins
events.event: Started his political career as a young man in Rome
events.personality: Adapts to political life, learning strategy and diplomacy.

events.title: Military Service
events.event: Served in the military and gained experience in warfare
events.personality: Disciplined and courageous, building early leadership skills.

events.title: Consul Election
events.personality: Ambitious politician, building alliances and consolidating power.

events.title: Crosses the Rubicon
events.event: Made the fateful decision to cross the Rubicon river
events.personality: Bold and decisive, committing to irreversible action.

events.title: Dictator of Rome
events.event: Became dictator and implemented major reforms
events.personality: Visionary leader, enacting reforms to consolidate Rome.

events.title: Consolidate Power through Reforms
events.event: This decision solidifies his support among the lower classes but raises concerns among the Senate.
events.personality: This decision reinforces Caesar's image as a visionary leader committed to the welfare of the people, while also deepening the divide with the Senate.

events.title: Strengthen Reforms for Popular Support
events.event: This decision boosts his popularity but intensifies opposition from the Senate.
events.personality: This decision reinforces Caesar's image as a champion of the people, while also highlighting his willingness to confront the Senate.
